alert.note: Alert for Breckinridge; Grayson; Hardin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 3:24PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Grayson, southwestern Hardin and southeastern Breckinridge Counties through 400 PM EDT/300 PM CDT/... At 324 PM EDT/224 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Leitchfield, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Grayson, southwestern Hardin and southeastern Breckinridge Counties, including the following locations... Dyer, Constantine, Limp, Saint Paul, Hudson, Vertrees, Buras, Graysville, Solway and Tar Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
